page.title: 19Salwarpe Parish Church
page.content: The parish church of Salwarpe, dedicated to St. Michael, is{Norman}in origin, but mainly 14th Century. The Lych-gate to the churchyard dates from 1884. Two 100 year old{Incense Cedars are a unique feature of the church-yard. A flight of 48{sandstone {steps}leads down from there to the River Salwarpe. These steps are known as "Jacob's Ladder". Like many small village churches, three parishes have amalgamated under one rector, and Salwarpe has joined with the parishes of Martin Hussingtree and Hindlip.
